documents.title: wall street closes higher
text: wall street closed higher , helped by news of an agreement to extend the debt limit , as stocks bounced back modestly from tuesday 's sell-off .

us stocks added to moderate gains as president donald trump , siding with democrats over his fellow republicans , said he agreed to pass an extension of the us debt limit until 15 december , potentially avoiding an unprecedented default on us government debt .
the dow jones industrial average rose 54.33 points , or 0.25 % , to 21,807.64 .
the s & p 500 gained 7.69 points , or 0.31 % , to 2,465.54 and the nasdaq composite added 17.74 points , or 0.28 % , to 6,393.31 .

documents.title: 'models will always be tall , thin , and very young '
text: a number of major french-owned fashion labels - including christian dior and yves saint laurent - have pledged to ban ultra-thin models from their advertising and catwalk shows .
but julia robson , former fashion editor at the daily telegraph , told the bbc that there would always be a market for models with a particular body type .
`` mannequins have always been very tall and very thin because aesthetically that 's what makes the clothes look very beautiful and almost otherworldly , '' she said .
`` and what we 've seen with globalisation and digitalisation is it 's brought fashion to a lot more people .
`` however , i think it 's quite tricky to sort of merge it all together and suddenly have , sort of , larger models on the catwalk .
`` i really ca n't see in my lifetime there 'll be a time when models are anything but tall , thin and very young . ''

documents.title: eu 'plans rule change to increase taxes on online giants '
text: european union finance ministers are set to discuss rule changes next week aimed at increasing taxes on digital multinationals such as google and amazon , reuters reports .

the estonian eu presidency wants to reform international tax rules so that digital multinationals could be taxed where they create value , and not only in countries where they have established their tax residence .

documents.title: banks 'dragging heels on brexit licences '
text: fewer than 10 of the approximately 40 banks that conduct eu business out of london have applied so far for a licence to continue banking in the bloc after britain leaves , regulatory sources have told the reuters news agency .
`` we 're having lots of meetings , but not enough concrete action , '' one supervisor said .

while britain does not leave the eu until march 2019 , bank executives have said time is already running out : it could take 18 months or more to set up a new subsidiary , given the need to relocate staff , get the requisite technology and change contractual arrangements with eu clients .

hurricane irma has caused casualties and `` significant '' damage in french caribbean territories , president macron says

documents.title: us seeks north korea oil embargo
text: the us has asked the un security council to put an oil embargo on north korea and freeze the assets of its leader kim jong-un , in response to north korea 's latest nuclear test .
it also sought a travel ban on mr kim .
in addition , the resolution called for a ban on textile exports and an end to payments made to north korean laborers sent abroad .

documents.title: xi : north korea issue must be solved by talks
text: china is focused on solving the korean peninsula nuclear issue through talks and peaceful means , chinese president xi jinping has told us president donald trump in a telephone call .
the us and south korea have asked the un to consider tough new sanctions on north korea after its nuclear test on sunday that pyongyang said was an advanced hydrogen bomb .

documents.title: us house approves lower safety standards for some self driving cars
text: the us house of representatives has approved a sweeping proposal to accelerate the deployment of self-driving cars without human controls and bar states from blocking autonomous vehicles .

the bill now goes to the senate and would allow automakers to obtain exemptions to deploy up to 25,000 vehicles without meeting existing car safety standards in the first year , a cap that would rise to 100,000 vehicles annually over three years .
car makers and technology companies including general motors and alphabet 's self-driving unit waymo have been pushing for new federal rules making it easier to deploy self-driving technology .

documents.title: cohn 'would do a great job as us fed chair '
text: goldman sachs chief executive lloyd blankfein said that his former colleague gary cohn would do a `` great job '' if he were to replace janet yellen as chair of the us federal reserve .
`` gary is very , very capable , '' mr blankfein said .
`` he 's not an academic , but i 'll tell you there is no one that has a better sense of markets . ''
mr cohn , a former goldman sachs president who is now a white house economic advisor , has been cited as a leading candidate to run the federal reserve over the coming years .

documents.title: us harvey deal includes debt ceiling extension
text: us president donald trump and congressional leaders have agreed to pass an extension of the debt limit until 15 december , as well as a government funding bill covering the same period and disaster aid for hurricane harvey victims , democratic senate leader chuck schumer and house leader nancy pelosi said .
the debt ceiling is a cap on the total amount the us government can borrow , set by us lawmakers .
`` both sides have every intention of avoiding default in december and look forward to working together on the many issues before us , '' mr schumer and ms pelosi said .
`` as democratic leaders , we also made it clear that we strongly believe the dream act must come to the floor and pass as soon as possible and we will not rest until we get this done . ''

documents.title: trivago warns of weaker revenue growth
text: hotel search firm trivago has warned investors of weaker-than-expected revenue growth in 2017 , due to lower spending from hotels and other travel companies .
the firm said its revenue would grow 40 % year-on-year , down from the 50 % it predicted previously .
trivago said it had not been able to adjust its own spending in line with reduced revenue , hurting profits .
the firm 's share price plunged more than 21 % in morning trade .
read more here .

documents.title: labour leave campaigner says brexit immigration ideas 'quite sensible '
text: labour mp kate hoey , who was a prominent leave campaigner during last year 's referendum , says some of the ideas in a leaked home office document are `` actually quite sensible '' .
`` we should be encouraging employers to employ more people from this country , '' she says .

it 's worth pointing out here that the uk unemployment rate fell to a 42-year low in august of 4.4 % - there 's not much slack in the uk labour market , and employers are finding it difficult to recruit staff .

documents.title: government asks ftse chiefs for unconditional brexit support
text: downing street has approached some of britain 's biggest companies asking them to give public support for the government 's approach to brexit .

the letter - which number 10 is hoping top business leaders will sign - says that while some backed leave and others remain , they acknowledge brexit is happening and now is the right time for employers to work with government to make it a success .

it says the signatories welcome the government 's commitment to negotiating an interim period after the formal exit date and would bring their expertise in international trade to bear on the government efforts to create future relationships outside the eu .

several potential signatories contacted by the bbc said while they supported the idea of bringing government and business closer together , they expressed reluctance to give unconditional support for a government negotiating strategy which they felt lacked clarity .
news of the letter came on the same day many business groups expressed grave concerns over leaked draft government proposals to clamp down on uk companies ability to recruit workers from the eu .
as one ftse chairman put it , its dangerous to ask a question when you are not sure what the answer will be .
number 10 declined even to comment on the existence of the letter this evening .
author: Simon Jack
BBC Business Editor

documents.title: canadian dollar soars after central bank raises rates
text: the canadian dollar hit its highest level against the us dollar in two years after the bank of canada surprised many by raising rates .
the greenback was modestly lower against a basket of major rivals .

the bank of canada raised interest rates by 25 basis points to 1 % after a hike in july , putting canada ahead of the curve in upping borrowing costs after they were slashed due to the 2007-2009 financial crisis .

documents.title: asda : 300 head office jobs to go
text: asda has said 300 head office jobs are to be axed .
an asda spokesperson said : `` in recent years , the competitive landscape in retail has changed significantly and asda has been no different .
our stores have adapted the way they operate to meet the changing needs of our customers , and our home offices must also adapt how they operate to support our stores .
`` today we are making some significant changes to the way we operate our home offices .
as you 'd expect , we have discussed the details of these changes with our colleagues first .
`` these changes impact around 1,100 roles across asda house in leeds and george house in leicester , and sadly result in around 300 colleagues leaving us .
`` at asda we value each and every one of our colleagues .
the changes are in response to the ever changing sector in which we 're working and the need to adapt to create an agile business which is fit for the future . ''

documents.title: ftse dips as korea tensions simmer
text: the ftse 100 share has closed down 0.25 % at 7,354.13 as geopolitical tensions simmer in the korean peninsula .

`` stock markets were rattled by suggestions that an intercontinental ballistic missile had been moved to the west coast of north korea and that the leadership might conduct a weapon test around 9 september , when the country celebrates its founding day , '' credit suisse said in a note .
wall street stocks have edged higher , but gains are being capped by north korea worries and a potential us landfall of hurricane irma .

documents.title: 'paying for trump access '
text: chief executives and lobbyists pay donald trump 's golf clubs to be members , and in return , get `` close contact '' with the us president , according to a usa today investigation .

`` members of the clubs trump has visited most often as president - in florida , new jersey and virginia - include at least 50 executives whose companies hold federal contracts and 21 lobbyists and trade group officials , '' the article says .

documents.title: uk government 'asks ftse firms for brexit endorsement '
text: the uk government has asked ftse companies to sign a letter endorsing its approach to brexit , the reuters news agency reports .

documents.title: fed 's fischer leave mid-october
text: us federal reserve vice chair stanley fischer , a veteran central banker who helped set the course for modern us monetary policy , has said he will step down in the middle of october .
in a letter to president donald trump , mr fischer , 73 , said he was resigning for personal reasons , and that the effective date would be on or around 13 october .

`` it 's been a privilege to serve on the federal reserve board and most especially to work alongside chair yellen , '' mr fischer said , citing improvements in the economy and financial system in recent years .
mr fischer 's term as vice chair was set to expire next year but his early departure gives mr trump an opportunity to shape the central bank sooner than expected .

documents.title: breakingfischer quits
text: stanley fischer , vice-chairman of the federal reserve , has resigned and will leave the us central bank in mid-october .

documents.title: asda to cut hundreds of jobs at head office
text: asda is to cut hundreds of jobs at its head office as part of a major cost-cutting drive at the walmart-owned supermarket .
the grocery giant informed affected staff in leeds on wednesday afternoon about the cull , which is about a tenth of asda 's 2,500 head office roles .
asda is in the middle of a turnaround plan under new chief executive sean clarke , who is attempting to halt falling sales as the supermarket engages in an ongoing brutal price war .

documents.title: breakingthomas cook pilots get strike go-ahead
text: a high court judge has refused to grant an injunction preventing thomas cook pilots from staging a 12-hour strike over a pay dispute .

documents.title: labour : scrap betting ads on football kits
text: labour says it would ban gambling firms from advertising on football shirts if it came to power .
the party 's deputy leader tom watson said football had to `` play its part in tackling britain 's hidden epidemic of gambling addiction '' .
nine english premier league clubs - and three in scotland 's top flight - have kits sponsored by betting companies .
gambling on football was worth a record £ 1.4bn to bookmakers over a 12-month period , figures revealed in may .
read more here .

documents.title: pay cap justification 'hollow '
text: nhs staff are demonstrating about the public sector pay cap in parliament square (
unison head of health sara gorton said :
`` faced with an exodus of staff across the nhs , ministers ' justification for keeping public sector pay cap simply sounds hollow . ''

documents.title: tech entrepreneurs 'dismayed ' at brexit immigration plans
text: leaked home office plans for a sudden cut in eu immigration numbers after brexit `` will be read with dismay by many of the uk 's fastest growing businesses '' says uk technology industry body tech uk .

`` to be a global leader we need access to global talent , the proposals would risk undermining the ability of companies to both recruit and retain talent and would send a worrying message to potential global recruits , '' says tech uk deputy chief executive antony walker .
`` to make a success of brexit the uk needs an immigration policy that supports the vision of global britain .
while only a draft , this paper does not fulfil that ambition , and we hope that government will bring forward a much more business friendly plan when officially setting out a post-brexit policy . ''

documents.title: goldman lowers chances of us government shutdown to 15 %
text: goldman sachs economists have downgraded the probability of a us government shutdown to 15 % from 35 % last week due to expectations that rebuilding efforts after hurricane harvey would reduce risks of a showdown over federal funding and the debt ceiling .
`` hurricane harvey has rearranged the fiscal policy agenda .
in the short run , the outlook has become more benign , '' the goldman economists wrote in a research note .

documents.title: intel antitrust fine is 'good news for consumers '
text: the european court of justice ( ecj ) earlier said that an antitrust fine handed down to intel in 2009 should be reexamined .
in 2009 , the european commission ruled that intel had abused its dominance in the processor market by seeking to offer rebates to pc manufacturers that used its chips instead of rivals ' products .

the ecj 's decision is `` good news for consumers '' , because it will make it easier for companies to offer discounts on future orders for high-volume buyers , said assimakis komninos , a partner at global law firm white & case .
`` while the intel case is about rebates , all major corporates being investigated by the european commission can take this as a positive sign , '' he said .

documents.title: trivago shares drop in pre-market trading
text: hotel price comparison site trivago 's shares have fallen by about 27 % in pre-market trading after it said it expects its results to be softer than planned .
the german firm now expects annual revenue growth to be around 40 % , while adjusted underlying earnings will be lower than in 2016 .

documents.title: hellawell 's vow
text: keith hellawell - the 75-year-old former police chief and government drugs czar - had previously pledged to step down as sports direct chairman if a majority of independent investors did not back him .
sports direct is controlled by founder mike ashley , who has a 61 % stake in the retailer .
mr ashley , who did not attend the meeting , is also the company 's chief executive .

documents.title: sports ' sid survives
text: the guardian 's sarah butler tweets :
simon bentley , senior independent director at sports direct also re-elected by independent shareholders with 55 % of the vote

documents.title: breakinghellawell re-elected
text: sports direct chairman keith hellawell has survived an attempt to oust him , with 53.2 % of independent shareholders voting for his re-election to the retailer 's board .

documents.title: pound climbs on dollar weakness
text: the pound is up 0.1 % against the dollar at $ 1.30460 , largely as a result of the dollar 's weakness .
it follows dovish comments from key policymakers at the us federal reserve , which suggest there will be no further interest rate rises before the end of the year .
paresh davdra , chief executive of rationalfx , said : `` sterling remains vulnerable to the euro , but its rise shows that the pound is still able to shake off pressure .
`` with parliament again in session and brexit negotiations under scrutiny from mps , politics look set to be a key driver for the currency [ going forward ] . ''

documents.title: character group wins pokemon toy licensing deal
text: postman pat and peppa pig toy maker chracter group has secured a licensing deal to distribute toys from the pokemon franchise in the uk and ireland .
character group will distribute action figures , play sets and plush toys based on the japanese animated characters from summer 2018 , thanks to a deal signed with wicked cool toys .
pokemon enjoyed a surge in popularity last year thanks to the release of pokemon go , an augmented reality mobile phone game .
the game smashed records , being downloaded more than 10 million times in its first week alone .

documents.title: more business groups voice concern over immigration paper
text: the eef and british hospitality association have also commented on a leaked report suggesting the government is planning much stricter immigration rules for eu nationals after brexit .
tim thomas , director of employment & skills at the eef , said : on the highly skilled side , the system described is one we can work with , after some changes .
but , we would have grave concerns that at lower skill levels accessing eu workers will be on a completely different basis going forward . ''

meanwhile , the british hospitality association said : if these proposals are implemented it could be catastrophic for the uk hospitality industry and for those who enjoy the hospitality it brings - whether it be in restaurants , theatres , hotels , bars and tourist attractions . ''

documents.title: sports direct chair defends zero hours contracts
text: sports direct 's chairman keith hellawell has defended the retailer 's decision not to move temporary staff off zero-hours contracts , saying a `` very large proportion '' of the workforce wanted flexibility .
speaking at the firm 's agm , he said zero-hours contracts `` were a legal form of employment '' and staff would not want to join the company if they were unhappy with the working conditions .
the former west yorkshire police chief also dismissed calls for an independent review of working conditions , claiming he did not see the benefit of outside consultants .

his comments came ahead of the result from a vote by independent shareholders on whether to reappoint mr hellawell , who said at last year 's agm that he would step down if the move received unanimous support from investors .

documents.title: global air travel soars in july
text: global demand for air travel rose 6.8 % year-on-year in july , the international air transport association has said .
this was down from 7.7 % june , but iata said demand `` continues to be very strong '' , with all regions reporting solid growth in passenger volumes .
however , it said the stimulus effect of lower fares was `` softening '' in the face of rising costs for carriers .
`` this suggests a moderating in the supportive demand backdrop , '' iata boss alexandre de juniac said .

documents.title: mars pledges $ 1bn to tackle climate change
text: the chocolate maker mars has pledged to spend almost $ 1bn on fighting climate change over the next few years .
the maker of brands such as snickers , skittles and m & ms wants to reduce its carbon footprint by 27 % by 2025 and 67 % by 2050 .
`` today , climate science is clear and we understand the environmental and social challenges in our supply chain better than ever before , '' said mars chief executive grant reid .
`` it is clear that the scale of intervention needs to be much bolder - now is the time for business to reassess its role and responsibility in the face of the evidence . ''

documents.title: cbi urges 'open approach ' to eu immigration
text: a leaked report suggesting the government is planning a much stricter immigration system after brexit seems to have some in the business community worried .
neil carberry , cbi managing director for people and infrastructure , said : `` an open approach to our closest trading partners is vital for business , as it attracts investment to the uk .
`` and , with employment high , it also helps keep our economy moving by addressing key skill and labour shortages .
`` businesses will look for the government 's final position paper to support an open but managed approach to immigration . ''

documents.title: luxury brands vow to protect models
text: luxury groups lvmh and kering have drawn up a charter governing how models should be treated , in order to guarantee their well-being and working conditions .
in the past , the fashion industry has been accused of using underage models , using `` zero-sized '' models , and discriminating against models on the basis of colour .
in march , kering brand balenciaga fired two casting directors for reportedly leaving 150 models waiting in a pitch black stairwell for hours while they went off to lunch .
the brands of lvmh and kering will now ban casting agencies from representing size zero models .
they will also follow specific welfare guidelines relating to models aged between 16-18 .

documents.title: france keen to ban oil and gas production by 2040
text: french lawmakers are considering a new law to ban the production of oil and natural gas in all its mainland and overseas territories by 2040 .
most oil and gas is imported , with french oil and gas production making up only a tiny fraction of national consumption .
nevertheless , the move would enable france to meet its commitments under the paris climate agreement , the financial times reports .
in july , france set out a climate plan that promised to halt hydrocarbon exploration and end the sale of petrol and diesel cars in france by 2040 .

documents.title: nice little earner
text: times financial editor patrick hosking has been taking a look at the fine print of the aveva/schneider deal .
aveva boss james kidd getting £ 1.5m `` one-off '' extra bonus for clinching schneider deal .
wonder what shareholders will make of that ?
it does raise the question of the difference between a 'one off ' bonus and an inducement as defined in the corruption act ?
probably happy with the 20 % increase in the share price i would imagine .

documents.title: off the hook ?
text: the british fishing industry , which employs 12,000 people , is concerned about having access to eu markets after brexit .
however , a sea law expert says it 's important not to lose sight of the bigger

`` we 've got to remember that most fish stocks are either over-fished or at risk , and we 're looking at threats from things like climate change [ and ] ocean acidification , '' hull university 's professor richard barnes tells bbc business live .
`` it 's really important that we do n't forget that we need to protect and make sure that fishing is sustainable for the future . ''
author: BBC Business Live

documents.title: hornby hits the buffers
text: it 's been far from a smooth journey at model railway maker hornby in recent months .
uk investment firm phoenix asset management has snapped up 70 % of the business , despite warnings from the hornby board that phoenix had undervalued the company .
now hornby has issued a profit warning , saying that its sales are behind expectations because of weaker demand over the summer and increased uk competition .
that has sent the shares down 6 % - bad news for the shareholders who have resisted phoenix 's offer so far .
despite being such a famous name , hornby is now worth a princely £ 25m .

documents.title: wpp invests in podcaster
text: advertising giant wpp is investing $ 5m ( £ 3.8m ) into gimlet media , the us podcasting company .
gimlet 's podcasts are downloaded more than 12 million times a month globally and its advertising clients include the likes of ebay , microsoft and goldman sachs .
in 2016 , wpp 's digital revenues were more than $ 7.5bn , representing 39 % of the group 's total revenues .
the advertising giant has set a target of 40-45 % of revenue to be derived from digital in the next four to five years .

documents.title: faint praise for ryanair 's new baggage policies
text: business live reader derek ryder thinks ryanair 's new baggage rules are a good idea , but only if :
they cut down the time you have to wait for your luggage .
twice i flew with them in the past two years and i had to wait for over an hour to reclaim it .
your hold luggage actually gets to your destination with you . ''
he does n't plan to use the airline anytime soon , though .
`` i fly easy jet now , '' he says .
`` would never fly with ryanair again . ''

documents.title: a reprieve for intel ?
text: europe 's top court has ordered a lower court to reconsider its rejection of an appeal by us chip giant intel against a fine for breaking competition rules .
in 2009 , the european commission fined intel a record 1.06 billion euros for offering clients price rebates to use its own computer chips in preference to a rival supplier .
intel then appealed to the general court , second only to the european court of justice ( ecj ) , but lost the case in 2014 .

on wednesday the ecj said : `` the court refers the case back to the general court so that it may examine , in the light of the arguments put forward by intel , whether the rebates at issue are capable of restricting competition . ''
a victory for intel would bring a rare defeat for the european commission that has not lost a major anti-trust case in decades .

documents.title: sports direct vote 'too close to call '
text: keith hellawell was voted out by independent shareholders at last year 's annual meeting - only to stage a lazarus-like comeback at a later extraordinary general meeting , where mike ashley used his 61 % stake in the company to make sure the chairman did not leave .
the result of today 's vote is far from clear .
while several institutions have made it known they will vote against mr hellawell , it is not clear they have enough votes to carry the day .
some other big holders have not made their intentions clear , while tracker funds - those that hold passive investments to track a stock market index - may not vote at all .
underlying today 's shenanigans is a broad dissatisfaction at the way sports direct is being run .
mr ashley made it the dominant force in sports retailing by following a `` pile-it-high , sell-it-cheap '' approach .
some investors are uncomfortable with his new `` selfridges of sport '' formula , which will entail a big spending programme .
they are also uncomfortable with his frequent trading in the shares of other retailers - he owns or has held stakes in french connection and debenhams , for example .
author: Dominic O'Connell
Business Presenter, BBC Radio 4 Today programme

documents.title: us lawmakers to vote on self-driving car testing bill
text: us lawmakers will today vote on a bill that would let tech giants test thousands more self-driving cars on the roads if they can prove their technology is as safe as regular cars .
in california where silicon valley is based , there are 27 firms that have been licensed to test self-driving vehicles , including samsung , but so far testing has been limited .
if the bill is approved , some experts are concerned there could be an increase in accidents .
`` human drivers are far more unpredictable than any conditions you can create in a test environment , '' said anna-marie baisden , the head of autos at bmi research .
`` it is definitely the riskiest period when you 've got that mix of both traditional cars and autonomous cars on the roads . ''
author: BBC Business Live

documents.title: barratt drags on ftse
text: shares in barratt are dragging on the ftse 100 , with the home builder down almost 3.4 % despite posting record annual profits .

connor campbell , an analyst at spreadex , said : `` that the company 's shares have climbed so high in recent months is partially responsible for this correction , as is the prospect of only 'modest growth ' in its next financial year . ''
fears over north korea and the threat of hurricane irma , currently in the caribbean and heading towards florida , also hang over the london market .
it 's now down half a per cent at 7,336.05 points..

documents.title: surprise fall in german industrial orders
text: industrial orders in germany fell unexpectedly in july following lower demand in both germany and the eurozone .
new orders decreased by 0.7 % month-on-month in july , according to federal statistics authority destatis .
orders from within germany fell 1.6 % and those from other eurozone countries were down 1.0 % , but contracts from the rest of the world increased by 0.6 % .

demand for german-made goods was down across all sectors , with orders for producer goods and capital goods falling by 0.4 % and 0.7 % respectively , while there was a 3 % drop in orders for consumer goods .

documents.title: ryanair baggage policies 'will cut delays '
text: business live reader elli di fiore says she is happy ryanair is cutting its checked baggage fees .
`` as a regular , frequent , loyal , once-a-month , if not twice a month passenger , i am delighted . ''
however , she adds : `` i must be the only passenger to be approving this new policy . ''
the reason , she says , is that people take advantage of `` free '' cabin space which leads to crowding and causes flight delays .

documents.title: one third of uk firms not following slavery laws
text: a third of businesses required by law to complete a `` modern slavery statement '' have failed to do so , with no consequences .
that 's according to the chartered institute of procurement and supply , which says about 10 % of uk firms have found evidence of slavery in their supply chains .
modern slavery refers to abusive practices such as forced migrant labour or child labour .

director kath hill said that under the law , all uk businesses with a turnover of more than £ 36m are required to file the statements , which detail what they are doing to `` find and eradicate slavery '' .
she said many were unaware of the legislation , which only came in in 2015 , and that consumers needed to pressure them to act .
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: asia stocks sag as north korea tensions simmer
text: markets in asia closed lower as worries about north korea continued to trouble investors .
japan and hong kong lost ground , while falls for auto stocks weighed on south korea 's index .
a weak session for financial stocks dragged australia 's market into the red .

documents.title: australian economy strengthens
text: australia 's economy has strengthened , boosted by government and consumer spending .
economic growth for the second quarter of 2017 was 0.8 % , up from 0.3 % in the three-month period to march .
this year australia 's economy celebrated a record 26 years without recession , despite growth slowing at the beginning of 2017 due to the impact of cyclone debbie in the east of the country .

documents.title: shares in franco manca owner dive
text: shares in fulham shore , the owner of the franco manca and real greek restaurant chains , have dived almost 24 % after it warned of challenging trading conditions .
the group said demand slowed in july and august `` primarily '' in its restaurants in london suburbs .
it believes this is a sector-wide problem and not unique to its brands .
but could it be something of a canary in the coal mine moment , given that spending on luxuries like eating out is the first to go when consumers start feeling hip pocket pain ?

micro focus is the biggest riser , up more than 4 % , after positive third quarter results .
homebuilder barratt is the biggest faller - down almost 3 % despite having posted a 12 % jump in earnings for the year to 30 june .

documents.title: flight check-in now possible with amazon alexa
text: united airlines passengers can now check in for their flights using amazon 's voice-activated virtual assistant alexa .
they will also be able to request information on a flight 's status and on-board amenities via the airline 's alexa app .
the new service will work with the amazon echo and the amazon echo dot .

documents.title: investors concerned at sports direct buy-back plans
text: shareholders of sports direct could vote against several resolutions put forward by founder and majority shareholder mike ashley at its agm today .
according to one , aberdeen asset management , a key concern is a plan to use the company 's money to buy back shares , which would reduce the number of shares available in the public market .

`` if that number gets below 25 % , then we will be faced with a situation where the company actually is no longer suitable for a premium listing and will fall out of the indices , '' said paul lee , head of corporate governance at aberdeen .

documents.title: bell pottinger puts itself up for sale
text: pr firm bell pottinger has put itself up for sale after a controversial campaign it ran in south africa sparked an exodus of clients .
the firm has appointed accountants bdo to look at options for the business including a possible sale .
on tuesday a major bell pottinger investor walked away from the firm and scrapped a plan to sell its 27 % stake .
chime , which counts wpp as a big investor , wrote off the stake 's value .
and overnight , hsbc became the first big-name client to confirm it was dropping the firm .
it comes after the firm was accused of running a pr campaign that stirred racial divisions in south africa

documents.title: barratt housebuilders build up profits
text: barratt developments has reported strong growth in pre-tax profits , which rose by 12.1 % to £ 765.1m over the past 12 months .
chief executive david thomas said : `` this has been another excellent year for the group .
we have delivered a strong operational and financial performance and our highest completion volumes for nine years .
`` we are committed to increasing the supply of new homes as the uk 's largest housebuilder and we remain industry leading in terms of quality and customer service . ''

documents.title: ryanair to reduce baggage check-in fees
text: airline ryanair is to reduce its baggage check-in fees and increase its size allowance .
it wants to encourage more customers to check in bags , reducing the number who take advantage of its policy of allowing two pieces of free carry-on luggage .
the firm said its overhead cabin space has been getting too crowded , which is causing flight delays .

documents.title: uk economy faces 'deep underlying problems '
text: michael jacobs , the director of the ippr commission on economic justice , agrees with the archbishop of canterbury 's comments on social inequality .
he says the gap between rich and poor has widened for multiple reasons , including the trade deficit , low corporate investment and low output in many parts of the country .

`` a lot of these individual problems have been analysed and economists are aware of them , but if you listen to public debates , ministers often talk as if the economy is doing quite well , and it really is n't , '' he told the today programme .
`` there are deep underlying problems and the main thing is that it does n't matter whether we talk about them , it 's whether we 're doing anything about them . ''
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: archbishop of canterbury calls for radical economic reform
text: the archbishop of canterbury , justin welby , says britain 's economic model is broken , as the gap between the richest and poorest parts of the uk widens .
britain stands at a watershed and must make `` fundamental choices '' about the direction of the economy , he said .
the remarks come in a report by a commission set up by the centre-left institute for public policy research .
the uk treasury said : `` employment is at a record high , the deficit is down and inequality is at a 30-year low . ''

documents.title: berkeley board faces shareholder revolt
text: we could see another shareholder revolt today - this time over pay at the home builder berkeley .
the board collectively took home £ 92m this year , and two shareholder groups are urging investors to vote against executives ' pay deals at the agm today .

jane sydenham of rathbones told wake up to money : `` although the company has been very successful and the share price has gone up , i think there 's the sense that shareholders are uncomfortable about the absolute sums of money being paid . ''
today 's vote is non-binding but comes at a sensitive time for berkeley , which is due to move into the ftse 100 next month .
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: hsbc latest big name to leave bell pottinger
text: banking giant hsbc has become the latest high-profile company to sever ties with troubled public relations business bell pottinger .
the pr firm has seen a loss of clients since being expelled from the industry trade body for a campaign stirring racial divisions in south africa .
on tuesday a major bell pottinger investor walked away from the firm and scrapped a plan to sell its 27 % stake .
chime , which counts wpp as a big investor , wrote off the stake 's value .

documents.title: could sports direct 's chairman go ?
text: sports direct 's chairman keith hellawell faces a grilling from shareholders today at the retailer 's annual general meeting .
after profits slumped , a string of big investors have said they will not back the former drugs tsar 's re-appointment .
jane sydenham , investment director at rathbones , told radio 5 : `` there are worries about the governance of the business and whether or not they have reformed their employment practices . ''
several big shareholders have already deserted the firm , she adds , and mr hellawell has to be seen to be governing the board properly .
if he is n't , he will inevitably have to step down .
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: north sea job losses 'worse than expected '
text: job losses in the uk 's oil and gas sector were worse than expected last year , according to a report from oil & gas uk .
the trade body found 60,000 jobs were shed , higher than the 40,000 anticipated .
deirdre michie , head of the trade group , blamed falling oil prices and rising costs .
`` we have been going through a sustained downturn and jobs have been lost as companies look to improve their business performance . ''
oil firms are now in much better shape to handle price volatility , she added .
